I think I have just the right recommendation for you! Based on your interest in Amharic language and plot keywords like "wrong" and "earlier", I'm going to suggest two movies from this list that might resonate with you.

Firstly, if you're looking for a classic tale of redemption, I'd recommend "Lord Jim". This 1900 adaptation follows the story of a sea captain who's determined to redeem himself after being discredited as a coward. The themes of regret and second chances are woven throughout the narrative.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something more introspective and thought-provoking, I'd suggest "Island". This 1962 film tells the story of a man lost at sea who finds himself on an island. The exploration of his past mistakes and struggles to come to terms with his new reality might strike a chord with you.

Both movies have a strong focus on character development and introspection, which I think would be a great match for your interests!

If you're looking for a thrilling ride with a hint of war, I'd recommend "Taken" (2008). This action-packed film stars Liam Neeson as a former CIA operative who must use his skills to rescue his daughter from a group of human traffickers. You'll be on the edge of your seat as he takes down bad guys left and right!

If you're in the mood for something lighter, "Anyone But You" (1996) might be more up your alley. This romantic comedy follows two people who reconnect at a wedding and pretend to be a couple, all while trying to figure out their feelings for each other.

If you're in the mood for something a bit more adventurous, "Flyboys" (2006) might be the way to go! This film tells the true story of the Lafayette Escadrille, a group of young American pilots who volunteered to fight for France during World War I. With impressive aerial action sequences and a strong cast, this movie is sure to take you on an exhilarating ride.
